question: 量る
userExplanation: Wani:This is a general word for measuring, as opposed to 測る that is more specifically for scientific or medical measurements.'
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>quantity</kanji>, but you don't "to quantity." To figure out the quantity, however, you have <vocabulary>to measure</vocabulary> / <vocabulary>to weigh</vocabulary> whatever it is you want to get the quantity of.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You need <vocabulary>to measure</vocabulary> the quantity of something, but don't have a scale or anything. Luckily, you are quite the <reading>hacker</reading> (<ja>はか</ja>) and hack together a scale using only rubber bands and beans.
